**Tender Announcement:** EZ897-240723 Fireside In Situ Remediation Program
==========================

**Contract Description**
-----------------------

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) is issuing a tender for the In Situ Remediation Program at the Fireside Maintenance Camp in British Columbia. The program involves injecting a hydrogen peroxide solution to remediate deep petroleum hydrocarbon (PHC) and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) impacts in soil associated with the regional aquifer.

**Background**
--------------

The remediation work will be conducted at the Fireside Maintenance Camp, a facility located approximately 380 km northwest of Fort Nelson, BC. The camp includes buildings for maintenance activities and residences.

**Objective**
-------------

The objective of the In Situ Remediation Program is to remediate deep petroleum hydrocarbon (PHC) and polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbon (PAH) impacts in soil associated with the regional aquifer.

**Scope of work**
-----------------

The scope of work includes:

* Injection of a hydrogen peroxide solution to remediate PHC and PAH impacts in soil
* Use of an existing water supply well at the site for mixing and diluting the solution
* Limited use of the Fireside Maintenance Camp for designated work areas

**Requirements**
---------------

* The selected contractor must have experience with in situ remediation projects
* The contractor must have a proven track record of environmental remediation work
* The contractor must be able to meet the specified timelines and budget
